data.title: Best adult place for a drink downtown!
data.text: This is the place to go if you want to have great service and conversation with your friends!  Akin, Adam & Mallory are amazing bartenders!  Their food choices are beyond bar food, the wings are delicious!  This is a great place for a group of friends or co-workers.  This is a bar, don't bring the kids!  It's part of the Battle House Hotel and very convenient for downtown business and visitors.

data.title: 50th High School class reunion
data.text: Stopped in to this wonderful Bar- Tavern at the Battle House Hotel in Mobile. It had a wonderful jazz pianist playing in the bar. This bar was clean well-located; service was superb. It was a fun relaxing evening with cocktails. I recommend.

data.title: Evening of Drinks and Music
data.text: I was staying at the Battle House overnight with some friends and they had plans with family, so I went to the bar to have a light supper and drinks.  I ended up waiting a while for my friends, so I enjoyed the piano player and the singer in the bar.  The bartender was nice, but I went to the bar for my drinks; he never came to my seat to check on me.  When my friends did arrive back, we sat for a while longer and drank and enjoyed the entertainment.

data.title: Great cocktails and piano music
data.text: They do a variety of well made cocktails. Go when the piano guy is there and enjoy a cocktail and some music and dancing.

owner_response.author: Scott M, Manager at Royal Street Tavern, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear WESTWOOD59,

I am glad you enjoyed the cocktails at the Royal Street Tavern at the Battle House Hotel & Spa.  John Anthony is one of our piano players and enjoys playing for our guests.  I hope you will stop back in and enjoy some music and dancing again in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Never again!
data.text: We sat there for almost a full 15 min and the bar tender would not even speak to us. At first i thought she maybe had people in another area she had to get drinks for. But then she started to clean a bit and never came back to our side of the bar. The place was dead so I know that wasn't the issue. She seemed a little "too good" to bother to wait on people

data.title: Nice Change of Pace from Dauphin Street Bars
data.text: Nice upscale bar if you don't like the casual bars on Dauphin Street. Piano Bar that can be really enjoyable listening to some uptempo 60s/70s/80s music.  Closes early - around 11pm on weekends so could stay open till midnight. We usually drop in and enjoy the piano playing and relaxing. Also nice that we usually stay at the Battle House anyway.

data.title: Great Paino Bar on Saturday Night
data.text: We retired to this comfortable place after a wedding reception. There were several people surrounding the paino and singing along to the versatile pianist. The bartenders were friendly and the atmosphere quite fun. I would recommend this on a Saturday evening for a nightcap.

data.title: Homey bar with great service!
data.text: Great bartender and selection.  Limited bar menu, enjoyable piano player.  Not too loud for conversation.

data.title: Great drinks w/ friendly folks
data.text: I've been to the Tavern several times and it continues to be one of my favorite bars in Mobile. Yes, it's a "hotel bar," but it functions more as a classy piano/jazz place.  Both as a hotel guest and just a visitor to the bar I was treated with great service and a good time. I'd recommend!

data.title: Terrible service from bartender
data.text: We live in Mobile, and have been to this bar a few times and have always had a good experience, except for tonight. The bartender was so preoccupied with something that he asked us three times to clarify our order. It was a simple order, just an extra dirty martini. He finally poured it in the shaker and then let it sit, and water down while he talked to a co-worker. He shook it maybe twice before he poured it in a glass and pronounced it "perfect". He also allowed a guest, who might or might not have been drunk eat out of the bar's drink condiment tray. Very disappointing for an upscale hotel bar charging premium prices. We have always been treated very well at this bar and have routinely taken out of town guests here for a look at the Battle House and a drink at the bar. We won't be doing it again.

data.title: Thank Goodness for Jack
data.text: Jack fed us when we were unable to get dinner at the hotel's restaurant.  He really cares about his customers.

data.title: Best Service
data.text: Good food, excellent service, a bit pricey but to be expected. We dined here twice and the waiter remembered us even though we'd been part of a large group the first time. He bent over backwards to make our dining experience excellent.

data.title: Upscale hotel bar
data.text: I rate this place because of the perfect Manhattan's which were..well..perfect.  I've drank alot of this drink in my time and there were THE best (a perfect Manhattan has both sweet and dry vermouth).  Piano was nice, seating is also nice - a group can enjoy themselves here and be able to talk.

data.title: trendy lounge inside the Battle House Hotel offers a relaxing atmosphere with music
data.text:
Wonderful Lemontini and the best lobster tacos ever! Their specialty are Martinis and Cocktails~
there were so many that I wanted to try.... I guess I will have to make another trip to Mobile to try out some more. The one that caught my eye was Anitra's Crème Brûlée Martini...

data.title: Very nice adult bar
data.text: We struck up a conversation with our very knowledgable bartender.  The manhattan was very tasty and the Hendricks plus lots of other yummy stuff drink that resulted from the discussion on what to do with That gin variety was surprising and delicious.  A nice place to warm the palate before dinner!

data.title: A nice pour, a relaxing setting
data.text: Before dinner at Trellis we stopped by for an adult beverage.  The Evan Williams Manhattan made the night start just right and Barb's Hendricks and Tonic tall was presented with elegance and style.

data.title: Intimate Place for Cocktails
data.text: After wandering downtown Mobile we weren't ready to head up to the room so we decided to wind down at the Tavern (which is located at the Battle House).  They had lovely live music, the decor was comfortable and tasteful, and the wait staff was very friendly.  Drink prices weren't outrageous, and they did serve some food (though we did not order anything, the homemade bacon and chive chips sounded interesting).  Recommend for a couple of a small group of friends who want to socialize without going to a club.
